alert.note: Alert for Custer (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 07 at 5:15AM CDT until June 07 at 8:15AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Oklahoma, northwest Oklahoma, southwest Oklahoma and western Oklahoma, including the following counties, in central Oklahoma, Canadian. In northwest Oklahoma, Blaine. In southwest Oklahoma, Caddo. In western Oklahoma, Custer. * WHEN...Until 815 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 515 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Weatherford, Clinton, Hinton, Hydro, Arapaho, Hammon, Custer City, Butler, Bridgeport, Foss Reservoir, Stafford and Cedar Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
